name: Movies from the '80s Online Quiz | 1980s Movies | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Abrahams and Zucker.

	"Looks like I picked the wrong week to give up sniffing glue". Lloyd Bridges, playing Steven McCrosky, is trying to give up all his bad habits!

questions.text: Who played Kirby Keger in "St. Elmo's Fire"?
questions.explanation:
Emilio Estevez.

	I find it amusing that several actors playing college graduates in "St. Elmo's Fire", also appeared as high school kids in "The Breakfst Club", which was filmed in the same year!

Kim Cattrall.

	Kim Cattrall has appeared in the HBO series, "Sex and the City". Did you know that she also played Karen Thompson, the female lead in the first "Police Academy" film?

Brian De Palma.

	Coppola directed the "Godfather" trilogy. Foley directed Pacino in "Glengarry Glen Ross" and "Two Bits". Lumet directed Pacino in "Dog Day Afternoon" and "Serpico".

questions.text: Name the film where we hear the following quote, "Can I get you anything? Coffee? Tea? Me?"
questions.explanation:
Working Girl.

	Joan Cusack, pretending to be a secretary, offers Harrison Ford a little light refreshment! Sadly for Joan, Harrison is more interested in Melanie Griffith!

questions.text: Rick Rossovich played Lt. Ron Kerner in "Top Gun". What was his call sign?
questions.explanation:
Slider.

	Did you know that Merlin was played by (a very young looking!) Tim Robbins?

questions.text: What was the name of the town in which "Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure" was set?
questions.explanation:
San Dimas & Dimas.

	Most of the film was actually shot in Arizona.

questions.text: How many different characters did Eddie Murphy play in "Coming to America" (according to IMDb.com)?
questions.explanation:
4.

	He played the main character, Prince Akeem. He also played Clarence and Saul, two characters from the barber shop, and Randy, the soul singer. Arsenio Hall also played a total of 4 characters, including a woman!

questions.text: What was the name of the show for which Janey and Lynn audition in "Girls Just Want to Have Fun"?
questions.explanation:
Dance TV.

	As well as featuring future stars Sarah Jessica Parker and Helen Hunt, Shannon Doherty also had a role in the film.

questions.text: Julia Roberts starred with Conchata Ferrell in "Erin Brockovich", but it wasn't the first time they'd shared the screen. In what 1988 film did they both appear?
questions.explanation:
Mystic Pizza.

	Ferrell played Leona, the owner of the pizza restaurant in which Julia Roberts' character worked.

questions.text: Who won an Oscar for their role in the 1982 film, "Tootsie"?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Lange.

	Although neither Hoffman nor Garr won an Oscar, they were both nominated.

questions.text: Who starred in the 1987 film "Who's That Girl"?
questions.explanation:
Madonna.

	The film was directed by James Foley, who also directed Madonna in some of her music videos, including "Papa Don't Preach".

questions.text: Who wrote the screenplay for the 1989 hit "When Harry Met Sally"?
questions.explanation:
Nora Ephron.

	Nora Ephron later turned her hand to directing, and made films including "Sleepless in Seattle" and "You've Got Mail".

questions.text: "Roxanne" is based on the french play "Cyrano de Bergerac". In both, the lead character is know for having a large what?
questions.explanation:
Nose.

	In "Roxanne", the lead character name is CD Bales. This name gives him the same initials as Cyrano de Bergerac.

questions.text: What future star of the "Charlie's Angels" films also starred as George McFly in "Back to the Future"?
questions.explanation:
Crispin Glover.

	He played Michael J. Fox's father in "Back to the Future", and the Creepy Thin Man in "Charlie's Angels".
